etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From alka- + amine, after French Alkamine

definitions: An organic compound containing both an alcohol (—OH) and an amino (—NH₂) functional group.

notes.text: Examples of such compounds include ethanolamine, HO—CH₂CH₂—NH₂, and norepinephrine, (HO)₂—C₆H₃—CHOH—CH₂NH₂.
